note.p: Career: Assistant (1712), then Surgeon (1724), Hopital des Invalides; Demonstrator of Surgery; travelled to England to learn the lateral operation for the stone from William Cheselden (FRS 1711); chief Surgeon, Hopital de la Charite (1730); Surgeon-Major, Gardes Francais; one of the founders of the Academie de Chirurgie
Memberships: Academie Royale des Sciences (1722); St Petersburg Academy; Stockholm Academy; Istituto delle Scienze e Arti di Bologna; Florence Academy; Academie de Rouen
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; NBG; Hirsch; Eloy
References: Jean Jacquot, 'Sir Hans Sloane and French Men of Science' in NR 1953 vol 10 pp 85-98
Notes: Proposed by James Douglas; John Douglas
